ðŸ”¥ Windows-MCP | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating Windows OS tasks using AI agents.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Seamless Windows Integration â€¢ Use Any LLM (Vision Optional) â€¢ Rich Toolset for UI Automation â€¢ Lightweight & Open-Source â€¢ Customizable & Extendable
ðŸ“– Summary: Windows-MCP is a lightweight MCP server that enables seamless integration between AI agents and the Windows operating system. It allows AI agents to perform tasks such as file navigation, application control, and UI interaction without relying on specific fine-tuned models or computer vision techniques. The project is open-source, customizable, and offers real-time interaction with minimal dependencies.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ firestarter | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Instantly creating AI chatbots for any website.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ RAG-powered search â€¢ Streaming AI responses â€¢ OpenAI-compatible API endpoints â€¢ Web scraping and content aggregation â€¢ Semantic search using Upstash
ðŸ“– Summary: Firestarter enables the rapid creation of AI chatbots for websites by crawling content, indexing it with RAG, and providing a ready-to-use chat interface and OpenAI-compatible API. It leverages technologies like Firecrawl, Upstash Search, and Vercel AI SDK to deliver streaming AI responses and supports multiple LLM providers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ tproxy | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring and analyzing TCP connections for backend service development, including gRPC and MySQL.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Proxies TCP connections â€¢ Analyzes network traffic â€¢ Monitors gRPC connections â€¢ Monitors MySQL connection pools â€¢ Provides connection statistics (retransmission rate, RTT)
ðŸ“– Summary: tproxy is a command-line tool designed to proxy and analyze TCP connections. It's primarily used for monitoring network traffic, especially for gRPC and MySQL connections, providing insights into connection behavior, reliability, and performance. The tool supports protocol-specific analysis and offers features like packet delay and speed limiting.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ awesome-cursor-rules-mdc | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating Cursor MDC (Markdown Cursor) rule files from structured data to enhance the Cursor code editor experience.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Generates comprehensive MDC rule files for libraries â€¢ Uses Exa for semantic web search to gather best practices â€¢ Leverages LLM to create detailed, structured content â€¢ Supports parallel processing for efficiency
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a tool to generate Cursor MDC rule files from a structured JSON format. It leverages semantic web search (Exa) and LLMs (Gemini, OpenAI, or Anthropic) to create comprehensive and detailed rules. The tool supports parallel processing, progress tracking, and a smart retry system for efficient rule generation.
